Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Requirement: • Pursuing bachelor degree• Minimum 1 year of working experience in showroom sales• Knowledge of Business Environment• Problem Solving• Self-management and could work independently• Know how to build the best relationship for the top relationship• Good communication skill and networking with local• Flexibility and strong commitment and under pressure• Ability to work as a team
Company Profile: MVL is a blockchain-based mobility company that started in 2018 that aims to build a reliable mobility ecosystem by recording data through innovative blockchain technology. Starting as a vehicle ride-hailing platform company under the name TADA, we have a business model that increases the application of blockchain technology through each new service we build.ONiON Mobility, a subsidiary of MVL, provides electric vehicles and related infrastructure mainly in Cambodia. TADA, another subsidiary, provides ride-hailing services mainly in Singapore, Cambodia and Vietnam and is building a mobility ecosystem by improving the profit structure of drivers through a new model that is completely different from existing companies.ONiON Mobility is actively conducting business in Cambodia by launching the T1, an eco-friendly version of the three-wheeled passenger vehicle “Tuk-Tuk”. We have established an EV factory to mass-produce our T1’s, and are operating electric vehicle charging stations all over the city of Phnom Penh. In addition to expanding our business throughout Cambodia, we are expanding our business to overseas regions by diversifying our product lineup, including the T1c for eco-friendly cargo transportation and eco-friendly bikes. In particular, the T1 provides a mileage of more than 100km and is an eco-friendly vehicle that does not have the inconvenience of long charging times by adopting a battery exchange method instead. ONiON has gained popularity in the local market by reducing maintenance costs of our E Tuk-Tuk’s by about 40% of the normal internal combustion vehicles because there is no need of frequent replacement of parts and high oil price. In addition, ONiON Mobility plans to collect and utilize all data generated from vehicles and stations for efficient operation and management at the MVL group level as well as to share the benefits to all the participants in the ecosystem created by MVL.

Job Description:
Reporting to the Manager, this role will involve acting as the first point of contact for visitors and clients of LLFitness. You will be responsible for ensuring our members and guests receive a warm and friendly welcome and any enquiries are dealt with in an efficient and professional manner. The receptionist will also deal with membership and sales enquirers as well as carry out administrative duties. 

PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITY AREAS 
1. To provide excellent customer service to our members and guests 
2. To deal with membership and sales enquirers and carry out administrative duties 
3. To ensure the gym studio areas are maintained to a high standard during each shift 
4. Provide support to management where required.
5. Full Time 
6. Can work at night shift
Job Requirement:
MAIN DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITES 
- Build a good rapport and relationship with all of our members and guests 
- Deal with customer enquirers in a friendly and efficient manner 
- Ensure that all financial transactions are completed in accordance LLFitness finance procedures 
- Manage the door entry and exit system 
- To actively promote and sell the various memberships available at LLFitness 
- Maintain and update the membership database system 
- Promote member challenges and initiatives 
- Able to seek solutions and resolve problems, as and when they arise 
- General administrative duties 2 

PERSONAL SPECIFICATION 
- Have a friendly and professional approach 
- First Aid Qualification desirable or willing to obtain 
- IT Skills including PC applications 
- Outgoing and confident with people of all ages 
- Speak/read/write English and Khmer 
- Ability to work shifts (flexible ours considered) 
- A genuine interest in Health and Fitness 
- Honest and reliable

Job Description:
This position reports to the Managing Director, Emerging Markets and Chief Marketing Officer is responsible for the
effective management of marketing programs in Cambodia.

- Develop and execute multi-year strategic plan as well as annual marketing program to deliver growth
- Develop and execute Trade Marketing Strategy to achieve defined business objectives across all product categories by putting in place, monitor and improve processes to link all Marketing activities with the activities of the Sales team
- Lead and support in the strategic development, implementation and optimization of digital marketing
campaigns, including media planning and reporting / analytics and launch activities and integrated campaign aligned with brand strategy across various digital channel activations
- Steering of agencies both creative & media to conduct project on-time
- Flawlessly implement and execute marketing strategies to support business objectives.
- Synthesize consumer insights and secondary market research to inform and optimize plans.
- Lead price pack category architecture within the channel, launching new SKU’s that better meet customer/consumer requirements and deliver against key internal financial KPIs.
- Lead communication to enhance brand awareness and likeability in digital platform.
- Develop understanding of key customers to implement annual promotional plan and marketing programs that will increase visibility and drive velocity within end consumers.
- Design and develop trade marketing program to support seasonal promotions, new product and program launches, and innovative marketing initiatives to drive volume and relationships/favorability with distributors.
- Ongoing management of product portfolio within the channel to ensure optimal assortment that delivers Execute POS materials and signage, sales collateral and sales presentations, ensuring adherence to all brand guidelines.
- SKU-level profitability. Includes partnership with sales managers and marketing associates to
launch relevant innovation of Yeo’s products channel.
- Develop innovative programs and pitch partnerships to incubate new products and drive total brand awareness in an effort to support retail business.
- Collaborate with sales to foster relationships with distributors and/or key customers, ensuring that
we are bringing forward relevant solutions and position products as an innovator and thought leader.
- Lead tradeshow strategy and execution ensuring that Yeo’s products are present visible at key industry shows.
- Collaborate with finance co-pilot and sales teams to deliver a holistic pricing and promotion strategy
that to deliver sustainable profitable growth.
- Partner with finance co-pilot and field sales analyst to develop ongoing reporting against plan KPIs.
- Integrate insights into monthly business meetings.
- Track and report competitive activities and product offerings.
- Provide administration support for marketing reports and submissions to finance department.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred.
- 5-7+ years of experience in marketing, trade marketing, brand management, or product management
- Experience in working closely with and/or leading sales teams is desired.
- Experience in consulting, channel marketing and/or B2B marketing is useful.
- Relevant social media management, digital marketing, on line community management experience is preferred
- Strong analytical and product management skills; comfortable with syndicated data as well disparate data/
comfort with ambiguity and/or limited data.
- Strong knowledge of marketing vehicles and fundamentals.
- Ability to analyze business trends and financial metrics, including sales, return on investments, and profit and loss.
- Entrepreneurial and resourceful with a drive to do what is needed to deliver growth – ability to think strategically, but not afraid of tactical execution; ability to work with limited resources.
- Highly effective project management skills.
- Must be able to work in a matrix environment, able to collaborate cross-functionally, and be a strong team player.
- Strong interpersonal skills.
- Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
- Ability to lead a small cross-functional team and collaborate with brand partners.
- Strong organizational and problem solving abilities.
- Functions effectively with ambiguity.
- Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Company Profile:
A Singapore Brand, A Global Business 

With a corporate history that extends more than a hundred years, Yeo’s (also known as YHS or Yeo Hiap Seng) has grown from strength to strength, from its humble beginnings as a striving enterprise in pre-war Singapore, to its transformation as a food & beverage conglomerate with a global network that spans Asia-Pacific, Europe, North America and Oceanic regions. 

A category leader in the Asian drinks market, Yeo’s has broadened its customer reach and entrenched its industry presence through a combination of geographical expansion and product diversification. On the beverage business front, Yeo’s competitive advantage lies in the Group’s ability to stay true and current to consumers’ changing palettes and individual preferences based on lifestyle and cultural differences. 

With a century of heritage, the Yeo's brand bears the hallmark of superior product quality. Yeos is committed to meeting evolving consumer needs and growing market demands through continued product innovation. 

We are honored to have won following awards in the recent two years: 
2017 Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Most Popular Regional Brand Overall Winner; 
2017 Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Regional Brands; 
2018 The Brand Laureate World Halal Brand Award 2018 - Best Brands in FMCG - Food & Beverage.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR & Admin   023 989 181 hrkh@yeos.com Phnom Penh Special Economic Zone, National Road #4,  Phum Tachet, Sangkat Beung Thom, Khan Kambol, Phnom Penh 023 989 181

Job Description: • Establishes financial status by developing and implementing systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying, and reporting financial information, and managing accounting staff.• Meets accounting financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.• Confirms financial status by monitoring revenue and expenses; coordinating the collection, consolidation, and evaluation of financial data; and preparing special reports.• Maintains accounting controls by establishing a chart of accounts and defining accounting policies and procedures.• Manage and oversee the daily accounting operations including month-end and year-end closing process, accounts payable/receivable, costing, general ledger and reconciliation of general ledger accounts.• Ensuring all accounting records are compliance with accounting standard as required.• Closely maintain and monitor the fixed assets system.• Responsible for all taxes obligations• Guides other departments by researching and interpreting accounting policy and applying observations and recommendations to operational issues.• Maintains financial security by establishing internal controls.• Avoids legal challenges by understanding current and proposed legislation, enforcing accounting regulations, and recommending new procedures.• Protects organization’s value by keeping information confidential.• Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.• Accomplishes accounting and organization mission by completing related results as needed.• Other tasks assign by manager.
Job Requirement: • At least 07 years in Accounting and Finance.• At least 02 years in management role.• Proficiency in ERP system, SAP is a plus.• Proficiency in computer skills (Ms. Office)• Proficiency in Khmer and English (reading, writing and speaking)• Must have strong analytical skills with good interpersonal skills.• Be honest, dynamic, flexible, highly initiative to act with sense of urgency or tight deadlines and problem solving skill.• Have good communication to work effectively and cooperatively with co-worker.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Description:
• Review tax working and tax payments
• Review and correct process errors, causing incorrect tax payment and tax filling 
• Review necessary paperwork for tax payment and returns
• Monthly and yearly reconcile per ta and per accounting to find out potential tax risk 
• Estimate and track tax returns
• Complete monthly and annual tax reports 
• Challenge and solve tax matter raise up by tax auditors 
• Organize and update the company’s tax database 
• Recommend tax strategies that align with business goals 
• Share financial data with the accounting department 
• Identify tax savings and suggest ways to increase profits 
• Follow industry trends and track changes related to taxes 
• Liaise with internal and external auditors 
• Challenge with tax auditors in unclear point of Law on Taxation 
• Write a protest letter to the tax department and also ruling letter when required 
• Coordinate with TP Consultant and Consultant in providing documents and get a comprehensive tax advise 
• Do all the assign work by the line manager
Job Requirement:
• At least 3 year experiences as leader in tax advisor or tax adult required 
• Experience in working with Tax Auditors, Ministry of Commerce, City Hall and other related authorities 
• Good English in communication both speaking and writing 
• Computer literacy (Ms Excel and Words) 
• Holding a tax agent certificate is compulsory 
• Knowledge in Cambodia Tax System, and Cambodian Tax Law
• Accounting knowledge and bookkeeping procedure in compulsory

Job Description: •	Responsible for the equality and workmanship of every activity, thorough knowledge of all phases of engineering construction relating to Civil, Architectural, Structural discipline interfacing the multidisciplinary operations•	Performa all daily inspection and test of the scope and character necessary to achieve the quality of construction required in the drawings and specifications for all works under the contract•	Develop and ensure QA requirements are incorporated into Tender Documents, Contracts And Purchase Orders•	Promotes quality awareness among project team members, contractors and vendors•	Assist in developing the Project Quality Management system by establishing procedures, plans, and work instructions as needed•	Establish and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure quality performance in different areas of work development and at various project Phases•	Monitor and report on compliance and nonconformities and maintain relevant records•	Identify and manage risks that could impact achieving quality objectives•	Follow up action items and maintain the status register•	Carry out and facilitate criticality assessment sessions and develop Quality Intervention Plans for procured items•	Take care of QA/QC documents of the entire project including certificates, calibration, test results, inspection requests, non-compliance reports and site instruction/observations, permanent materials delivered and other QA/QC documents•	Develop method statement for the activity including risk assessment and job safety environmental analysis and Inspection Test Plan and Checklist based on specifications of the project•	Carry out the internal audit at the site as scheduled in the Project Quality Plan
Job Requirement: •	Education: Bachelor Degree in Civil or Structural engineering•	Computer fluency in word, Excel and PowerPoint•	Good interpersonal skills, must be able to communicate well with staff•	Excellent communicator with impressive numeracy skills to handle the financial and mathematical demands of the role•	Demonstrate innovative approaches to problem-solving and an ability to negotiate across the various levels of any construction environment•	Strong team player, working effectively with all staff members at all levels•	A positive work ethic with excellent attention to detail and accuracy•	Ability to work autonomously to meet deadlines

Job Description: - To manage and coordinate the activities of all the staff members engaged in inventory   control and inventory record accuracy- Ensure stock availability by maintaining optimal levels of stock at all times, foresee   supply and demand, taking a strategic approach to replenishing so that both overstocking   and running out of stock are avoided- Provides inventory analysis to support store operations throughout the physical and post   inventory- Handle purchases and transfer by carry out the entire phase of product purchasing, from   selecting to tracking shipment and receiving orders, to ensure that purchases arrive on   time and in good condition and also take charge of internal stock transfers, moving   products to other store branches- Develops and implements procedures to ensure all inventory is accounted for and reported   accordingly to company policy- Ensures that inventory counts are completed regularly and in a timely manner- Review daily inventory reports for possible errors and reports information to upper   management and finance Department- Maintain an accurate inventory of both stock items and transactions, noting down dates   of purchase and receipt, item count and detail, issues encountered, and more,   consolidate this into regular reports presented to other department units such as   finance- Evaluate suppliers and inform all the details to Procurement Department and Head of   Department related to schedule of delivery and quality of the products etc…- Report to upper management on stock levels, issues etc.…- Checked the quality and Counted all the items when received stock from supplier- Stamped and singed on the Invoice and make a copy keep them in folder for record- Entry all received items into POS System and make correct- Send the list of items to the requestor and informed them about the quantities. Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

1- HLH Agriculture (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

4- Jewel A Development Co., Ltd.

- Manage and control inventory stock counting/inventory accuracy checks.

- Price list controlling and keep document in place.
- Maintain selling price and standard cost in system SAP.

- All price increasement, must be approval by manager.

- Verify Sanofi rebate amount with SAP amount.
- Verify stock Sanofi ending balance each month on rebate file.
- Verify actual customer value by quarterly by clients.

MANAGER.

Company Profile:
Established in 1996, Creed Group is a Japanese real estate investment group with a primary focus on the Southeast and South Asia real estate market. Our portfolio ranges from Real Estate Investment, Asset Management, Project Development to Property Management. To date, we have amassed an aggregate Gross Development Value (GDV) of US$800 million for our projects.
Before focusing on the emerging markets of Southeast and South Asia, we had amassed nearly 15 years of experience in the mature real estate market in Japan. Through our abundant expertise from Japan, and forming strategic partnerships with the best local players in respective countries, we are dedicated to providing the best Japanese quality development for promising emerging markets.
Currently, our business spans across 9 countries including Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Lao PDR and Cambodia.
Here at Creed Group, we are highly committed to our mission of “Offering Japan Quality to Emerging Markets” through strict adherence to three fundamental values; “Integrity”, “Objectivity in Assessing the Truth” and “Originality”.

Job Description:
The purpose of this role is responsible to develop the web/mobile application and software requested from CMI & CMTR business units. This role must, at regular intervals interact with the IT Department and business user to understand the specification or issue. He/she able to provide technical support hardware and software across the company.

1.Designs, develop and modify software application based on functional and system requirements, according to code standards and user interface design guidelines.
2.Performs program maintenance, modifications, and enhancements to existing applications through programming, testing, documenting, and training users.
3.Contribute clean code to ensure a consistently high-quality standard.
4.Setup and troubleshoot software, hardware, network, printer, scanner, fingerprint, and equipment in meeting room
5.Repairing and replacing equipment as necessary
6.Another task as per assigned by the manager
Job Requirement:
•At least 1-2 years of experiences in software installation and software development
•Experience in IT Support, Programming, or related field (Fresh graduated encourage to apply)
•Experience as a software developer using technologies such as ASP.Net/.NET Core/C#, SQL Server and HTML5/CSS3 and 
•Experience with web services such as JSON, XML, SOAP, REST
•Knowledge of Design Pattern, OOP
•In-depth knowledge of computer hardware, software, and networks
•Knowledgeable about the software development life cycle (Agile, Waterfall, maintaining the ERP application or project is an advance)
•Good verbal and written communication skills
•Good communication, fast learner, and willing to learn
•Ability to work under tight deadlines and pressure.

Job Description:
- Key responsibility of the Head of Credit Risk & Compliance includes but not limited to: (i) maintain healthiness of credit quality control and management via credit risk assessment, identification and management; (ii) conduct portfolio analytics with various factors that might impact to entire loan portfolio and PAR performance of the Bank, (iii) report early warning indicator of credit risk that might occur and impact the Bank, probability of default, exposure at default, and loss given default; (iv) set out the credit risk acceptance level, credit risk appetite, credit risk tolerance, credit risk threshold and credit internal risk rating; (v) conduct credit stress-testing and industrial sector update; (vi) establish compliance culture and awareness and its obligation to all staff; (vii) conduct compliance risk measurement, monitoring, control and review; and (viii) update compliance checklist to related Depts as well as review the policies/procedures/guidelines in case there’s any loops of non-comply issue, and update local laws and regulations more frequent to all Depts.

Credit Assessment and Evaluation
	Provide credit analysis to CA that are submitted by lending team, build local knowledge on credit risk assessment and management, build expertise in the writing up of the CA and how to address risk and its mitigation.
	Provide independent assessment and review on credit quality and jointly approve loans and/or any other according to approved empowerment matrix.
	Review credit policies/guidelines to align with the changes in the industry, economic situation, property sector, government guidelines and regulators and loans according to approved empowerment matrix.
	Work with legal on any loan documentation amendments; ensure and monitor loans disbursed are as per approved terms and in compliance with guidelines; ensure clear turnaround timeline in the preparation of loan documents; and ensure and monitor proper control and safe keeping of security documents.

Credit Monitoring and Portfolio Analytics
	Conduct credit review and closely monitor the trend of credit portfolio and the movement of PAR to maintain a good credit quality, including credit risk identification, repayment capacity ratio, credit risk rating, credit risk appetite, ED rate, PD rate, LGD rate, and underwriting guidelines and procedures.
	Initiate credit risk management framework which includes rating methodology, qualitative and quantitative analysis, early warning indicator, risk acceptance criteria, sectorial limit risk, credit stress-testing, credit contingency plan, and credit strategy.
	Participate actively with various internal credit initiate projects, new product development policy review with highly qualified SOP with other related Departments, as well as credit policies and procedures, guidelines review and recommend to related Departments in term of risk protection and mitigation.

Legal and Compliance Management
	Ensure the entire banking operation works in compliance with the country’s laws and regulations; enhance compliance management and control via update compliance check list more frequently whether on NBC and other regulatory checklist and internal compliance checklist; participate in compliance training to establish the compliance awareness culture to all staff.
	Establish, implement, maintain, evaluate and improve the compliance management includes but not limits to strategy and scope, governance and accountability, framework and documentation, compliance planning, and evaluation and improvement.
	Monitor the legal status related to the Bank’s each activities and maintain the lawfulness; monitor the amendment of laws and regulations and advise the Bank the best cope with the situation; and manage law suits and other disputes and advise to relevant Departments.
	Provide legal review on various contracts, agreement, terms and conditions for products and services of the Bank, MoU and other legal documents processing such as capital registration from NBC, Branch Certificate from MoC and GDT, patent tax and any other approval letters from the government.
Job Requirement:
	University degree and/or professional qualification in Banking. 
	Completion of finance / management courses would be an advantage.
	Experience in similar lending position for at least 3-4 years (working for foreign banks preferable) 
	Integrity and honestly.  
	Strong ability to work in a team. 
	Self-motivated.   
	Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively deal with people from a wide diversity of culture and social environments. 
Sound analytical and problem solving skill.
Experience Profile
Summarize the pre-requisite skills and knowledge required to perform this position, as well as any formal qualifications or training needed.
	Experience in similar lending position for at least 3-4 years (working for foreign banks preferable)

Job Description:
* Provide independent verification and audit findings to Board of Director, Chair of Audit Committee and Chief Executive Officer about the CCU bank’s internal control, financial statement and other systems of the bank that consistently performed, recorded and complied with the approval internal policies and regulations or prakas from NBC and related ministries to achieves its objectives effectively, efficiently and harmoniously.
- SUPERVISION/MANAGEMENT TASKS:
	Prepares annual audit schedule, budget and staff planning and discuss the IA plan for getting the approval from Audit Committee
	Develop new strategic to improve the quality of Audit Execution to meet the International Audit Standard (IAS) 
	Develop and update Internal Audit Charter, Internal Audit Manual, Internal Audit Procedure and Internal Audit Program (audit working paper) to adopt to business change of the bank and apply with Internal Audit Standard such as COSO and IPPF framework
	Reviews existing audit program and procedures/guidelines to meet new established system in the bank for internal auditor(s) to implement the internal audit function
	Provide development training to ensure the Internal Audit staff have knowledge and competence to perform their duty efficiently
	Leads internal audit team to conduct the regular internal audit at the branches and Head Office’s activities in an effective, professional and timely manner
	Ensures that implementation of internal auditors is accomplished according to established plan by the internal audit department
	Check the efficiency of implementation audit procedures from Internal Auditor and provide the suggestion to correct weaknesses and lack of control to staff
	Analyses audit results to determine methods for increasing profits and decreasing unnecessary costs
	Provides necessary trainings to Internal Audit members in order to build and improve their capacity on relevant course for conducting the audit course at the bank
	Conduct performance appraisal for Internal Audit Staff, including setting performance objectives and regular monitoring
	Strengthens the internal audit department with regard to the management, credit activities, and financial information
	Assists in the hiring, selection and placement of the new staff, as requested
	Coordinate with External Auditor, NBC Auditor and other assessors when required
	Attend weekly and monthly management meeting with the Bank’s senior management
	Consults with management of the bank and staff on improvement of operation and other issues
	Attend the meeting or workshop with NBC or ABC
- FRAUDS INVESTIGATION: 
	Leads any special appraisals, inspections, investigations, examinations or reviews on frauds, suspect cases or irregularities requested by the Senior Management and/or Audit Committee.
	Leads internal audit team to check the cash balance if there is any fraud that committed by the staff to know how much of cash was committed by staff and to ensure that the cash in vault and cash report in system remaining balance is correct
	Report to the senior management, audit committee and board of directors to take action on fraud happened that committed by staff
- INTERNAL AUDIT EXECUTION: 
	Reviews system and operations to assess the extent to the bank’s objectives are achieved and the adequacy of controls over activities leading to such achievement
	Review the policies and procedure of the bank to find the gap of risk and provide the recommendation to improve
	Evaluate the relevance, reliability and integrity of management and financial information
	Appraise utilization of resources regarding to economy, efficiency and effectiveness
	Access the means of safeguarding assets and verify their existence
	Recommend improvement in procedures and system to prevent waste, extravagance and fraud
	Advise on appropriate systems of controls and other accounting and operational matters in a consulting
- REPORTING: 
	Review and add sufficient comment to improve quality of Internal Audit Report from subordinates
	Issue a draft audit report have been done by internal auditors and circulate to the management for doing management response and take action to the audit finding
	Finalize on Internal Audit Report and submit to Branch Manager, Head of Operation, CEO and Audit Committee
	Prepare audit committee report and agenda for Audit Committee meeting quarterly
	Attend and present key audit finding to Audit Committee during the quarterly meeting
	Follow up and report the result to the Audit Committee of the progressive in the implementation from auditee on audit findings and the adequacy of the bank’s internal control on a frequent basis
	Express and overall impression of the audit opinions to the senior management and/or the audit committee, and draw attention to any failure to take remedial action
	Coordinate with compliance officer to prepare the annual internal control report for NBC
	Perform other tasks assigned by CEO, Audit Committee and BoD.
Job Requirement:
* Key competencies required for this role
-	Demonstrate high level of ethical commitments and trustworthiness
-	Bachelor’s degree in accounting required, MBA/CPA is preferred 
-	Minimum 6 years of auditing experience or financial management, including 3 years in a middle management / supervisory position, and 3 years experiences in auditing, preferably in financial sector
-	Strong knowledge of internal control structures and risk management
-	Ability to understand and use research to information design 
-	Good understanding of the national legal framework, including taxation and legal compliance
-	Integrity, honesty, Independency and principled individual
-	Able to make sound judgments, relevant and practical recommendations
-	Good interpersonal skills, including the ability to coach and train others
-	Willingness to travel to provinces for audit, evaluation work, and other assignments
Experience Profile
Summarize the pre-requisite skills and knowledge required to perform this position, as well as any formal qualifications or training needed.
-	Minimum 6 years of auditing experience or financial management, including 3 years in a middle management / supervisory position, and 3 years experiences in auditing, preferably in financial sector

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Company Profile: Thriving in the Kingdom of Wonder, TPMG prides itself as Cambodia’s leading, one-stop premier property developer, transforming spaces and designing life. Our portfolio ranges from land acquisition to full-scale development, including residences, smart-technology integrated developments, and shopping malls. Job Description:
Purpose of the position:
- Responsible for effective and efficient implementation of FIT , overall and specified promotions in individual designated outlets by ensuring all activities are properly carried out according to the Quality, Availability, Affordability and Perfect Execution (QAAP) standards 

Core Responsibilities:
- Proactively implement the 6 steps call 
- Effectively and efficiently implementing the Picture of Success (PicOS)  
- Regularly visiting customers according to Journey Route - - Plan generated from current available support system - SFA and provide excellent sales and customer service, and report any change of customers 
- Continuously and gradually achieving monthly sales target set 
- Ensure healthy of all product range in all outlets of designated area 
- Establish, maintain and develop positive relationships with all outlets 
- Expand new business opportunities through: 
- Opening of new outlets within the designated area of coverage 
- Identifying, initiating and selling-in of consumer promotions  
- Ensuring selling-out of CAMBREW’s products/brands from the outlets 
- Creating exclusive outlets 
- Provide Coaching to the assigned Sales Representative in your province / area 
- Share best practice and key success/failure learning to the team
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree of business, sales/marketing, or related field preferred 
- Proficiency in English speaking and writing is favourable 
- At least 2 years experiences in leading or managing a team, ideally in FMCG/beer environment 
- Potential in analytical skills with a problem-solving attitude 
- Effective, positive and energetic attitude 
- Innovative and systematic person capable of cooperating across the function 
- Ability to communicate clearly - Decent presentations skills 
- Team-orientation and ability to coach the team 
- Strong leadership skills 
- Action-oriented, persistent and result oriented 
- Solid planning or organizing skills 
- Positive attitude towards beer and alcohol industry  
- Potential in developing knowledge of sales planning, marketing and development 
- Able to work independence and work as a team  
- Good computer literacy: Ms. Office, Excel and E-mail 
- Valid car driving license

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities

Responsible for the overall financial accounting including taxation:
•	Ensure financial statement is produced accurately and complying with accounting standard tax regulation
•	Ensure timely, accurate completion of the monthly financial close
•	Managing closely on cash flow forecast and cash position on weekly and monthly basis
•	Ensure all balance sheet accounts are reconciled and signed off on a monthly basis to Month end deadlines
•	Liaising with internal and external auditors
•	Formulates and implements financial policies, analyses business information and advises management on overall business operations

Others
•	Work closely with Head, Finance & Accounting and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and other relevant management team.
•	Carry out other duties appropriate to this post as requested by line manager.
Job Requirement:
Position Requirement 
•	Bachelor Degrees in Accounting, banking and finance or related field, ACCA preferably.
•	At least 3-5 year experiences required.
•	Strong leadership, strategic thinking, results-focused and proven ability to collaborate across functions and with all levels of the organization.
•	SAP system, Excel and Computer literacy.
•	Good knowledge in accounting and taxation in Cambodia.
•	Good command in English.
•	Good at problem solving and be able to work as group.

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.

Company Profile:
Start your career at Arup, listed in Engineering News Record as one of the top “Best Green Design Firms”, “Top Global Design Firms”, and featured on Fortune Magazine's "Change The World" list of companies that are making the world a better place.

Arup is an independent engineering and consulting firm of 14,000 people in 42 countries around the world. Founded in 1946, we are the creative force at the heart of many of the world’s most prominent projects in the built environment, including the Sydney Opera House, the London Eye, and the Beijing National Stadium (aka the Bird's Nest).

During your career at Arup, you’ll have the chance to engage in a fulfilling career and work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You’ll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment.

Job Description:
•	Serve a designated portfolio of accounts in the Banking business segment.
•	Develop the portfolio by prospecting new clients, cross selling and offering suitable business banking services to existing customers.
•	Achieve various business banking targets and contribute to the performance of the team.

Job Description:
1. Greeting customers and receipt them for serving. 
2. Ensure that the service provided to customers meets the company's quality, standard, and target.
3. Communicates with technicians about vehicle statuses, and ensure the vehicle will be ready on time for the customer.
4. Maintains a positive relationship with customers to ensure repeat and return customers.
5. Deliver vehicle to customers with clear service explanation.
6. Handle and resolve customers' complaints regarding the service.
7. Answers the customer questions about service, including when expecting vehicle repair.
8. Conduct frequent communication with customers via phone calls, emails, regular mail, and visits to their premises to build a strong relationship.
9. Highly committed to ensuring that the company's minimum sales target is met.
10. Collect, analyze, and evaluate competitor and market data to create a sales strategy.
11. Conduct after-sales service reminder calls to ensure that customers understand the benefits of servicing and maintenance and that they keep to their scheduled servicing.
12. Support colleagues and peers whenever necessary.
13. Weekly update to management on target achievement, challenges, and improve performance plan.
14. Report to the manager on daily-weekly-monthly service performance.
15. Other reporting assigns by the management.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor's degree in Management, Business Administration, or related fields.
- Fresh graduate with outstanding results and achievements
- A team player who takes initiative, is friendly, service-oriented, and has excellent communication skills.
- Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint.
- Open mind to learn new things and other job assignment.
- Appearance is suitable for front desk and facing customers.
- Be able to work under pressure.
- To be honest, patient, reliable, etc.
- Good knowledge of using computer MS Office, Internet, and E-mail.
- Good command of both written and spoken English.
- Must have a driving license and be able to drive well.

Company Profile:
Amaya is a new housing  development, offering unique, refined, mindful and architecturally designed 1, 2 & 3 bedroom holiday homes in Kampot Cambodia. 

Amaya, in many languages, relates to nature and place. As a brand, they are strongly influenced by the environment, and are guided by the belief that people’s homes and surroundings shape who they are, and who they become. Living harmoniously with the natural environment and nature. Amaya’s name is a reflection of the Company’s and Founder’s values and what it stands for. A balance of nature, and community where people can connect with their best selves. 

Its Vernacular Architecture is both sophisticated with simplicity, purposefully designed and spacious to best integrate with the natural environment as it levitates above the hillside terrain. Amaya is not a typical holiday home. It is a unique living experiences. 

Its headquarters are located in Phnom Penh, and are currently looking for aspiring teams to join the company.

Job Description:
• Manage and oversee the daily operations of accounting including, account payable and account receivable, daily, weekly and monthly cash flow, weekly cash count, month and year-end process, cash receipts, general ledger verification, monthly payroll, budgeting, cash flow and forecasting, review on payment voucher, revenue and expenditure variance analysis, capital assets reconciliations and bank reconciliations.
• Establish and maintain fiscal files and records to track document transactions. 
• Ensure accuracy and timely monthly, quarterly and yearly end close.
• Monitor and analyze accounting data and obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
• Establish and enforce proper accounting methods, policies and principles.
• Improve accounting systems, procedures and initiate corrective actions.
• Assign projects and direct staff to ensure compliance and accuracy
• Meet financial accounting objectives.
• Accomplish accounting and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
• Train, coach and discipline staff to ensure high productivity and morale.
• Perform other tasks as per assigned by the Head of Finance and Accounting.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor's or master's degree in Accounting, Finance, CPA/ACCA students or relevant degree.
• At least 5-6 years experience in the accounting field with 2 in management roles (real estate is preferable).
• Experienced using QuickBooks, Excel and other programs.
• Good command Knowledge of Cambodia's taxation laws and accounting software (SAP Accounting System is preferred)
• Knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures.
• Strong leadership, high motivation, and problem-solving skills.
• Active, Friendly, Honest and Reliable. 
• Honesty, Positive, Energetic, and hard-working
• Demonstrated ability to work with and across different teams
• Strong command of English, both speaking and writing.
• Good morale and integrity.
• Organize tasks, set priorities, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks.
• Demonstrate good judgment and good problem-solving skills. 
• Respond appropriately to evaluation and changes in the work setting.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Company Profile:
TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. (previously called TOTAL Cambodge) is an affiliate of TotalEnergies, a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people. 

TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been officially operating in Cambodia since 1993. Throughout the country, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been involved in marketing various energy and lubricants products and services to its customers in both the private and public sectors. We offer a wide range of products through more than 100 service stations with over 52 Bonjour Shops, Industrial fuels, Aviation fuels and lubricants. Through the TotalEnergies Card, customers are offered a convenient way to make and manage fuel purchases. Other services offered include used oil analysis, tank installations and bulk deliveries to many of our Commercial customers.

In view of supporting its growth in Cambodia, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.  is looking for a talented and motivated candidate for the position as follow:


Applications should be submitted via email: sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com *Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms Lypy LY   sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com ANINA Building 6th Floor, No 240, St 271, Beoung Tumpun, Meanchey, Phnom Penh – CAMBODIA

Job Description:
** Key Responsibilities:
- Plan, implement, monitor, and continually improve Depot Technical Project
- These includes but not limited to acting as the focal person for programs such as the Group HSEQ audits & reports, HSEQ Training Program, HSEQ related projects, security
Improvement programs, government & community relations programs, and environmental management programs.
- Plan, implement, monitor, continually review/improve the Depot planned equipment/vehicle maintenance program, including maintenance of critical spare parts.
a. Control and maintain stock of critical spare parts.
b. Overall control maintenance work inside the depot, both done by own staff and contractors.
c. Control, execute, and provide training to other of relevant systems.
d. Control and issue work authorizations and special work permits inside the Depot
- Plan/organize the Depot safety meetings and emergency drills.
a. assist the Depot Manager of stock loss control program and activities/reports.
b. Overall custodian of HSE and technical documents & records
- Assist the Depot Manager in developing the individual HSE objectives & performance standards of each Depot's employees
- Support Technical Integrity Manager of Safety Barrier Gap Analysis, Description of all Safety Barriers, Finalization of all tests of safety barriers, Integration of safety barriers and schedules, Reporting of KPIs and Downgraded Modes (Ramses), Technical Review and Commissioning.
- Closely coordinate with affiliate/regional project team regarding facility improvement/expansion to avoid disruption of depot operation as well us project timelines
Job Requirement:
- Educational background: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering of Electrical
- Experience: At least 3-year experience in engineering, electrical, electronic, & Equipment maintenance. A good understanding of the oil products market. 
- Knowledgeable on Technical Integrity system or modern safety management system.
- Skill: Big-picture perspective; team spirit; open-mindedness; listening skills; ability to generate new ideas and demonstrate conviction and influence; organizational skills; interest in coaching and team development. Good command of English writing and speaking. Valid driving license.
- Knowledge: MS Office- Excel and PowerPoint, Internet and Email proficiency, is preferable
- Language: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking.
Company Profile:
TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. (previously called TOTAL Cambodge) is an affiliate of TotalEnergies, a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people. 

TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been officially operating in Cambodia since 1993. Throughout the country, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been involved in marketing various energy and lubricants products and services to its customers in both the private and public sectors. We offer a wide range of products through more than 100 service stations with over 52 Bonjour Shops, Industrial fuels, Aviation fuels and lubricants. Through the TotalEnergies Card, customers are offered a convenient way to make and manage fuel purchases. Other services offered include used oil analysis, tank installations and bulk deliveries to many of our Commercial customers.

In view of supporting its growth in Cambodia, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.  is looking for a talented and motivated candidate for the position as follow:


Applications should be submitted via email: sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com *Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.

Job Description:
- Position Title: Café Business Intern
- Reporting Line: Non-Fuel Manager – Café Business

** Key Responsibilities:
* Admin Work:
- To give supports on market research, marketing and product development.
- To follow up the sales commissions (with supports from sales team) and manage stocks (with supports from Manager/partners).
- To assist to Manager or/and coordinate with other departments to complete administrative document or request for legal document/ materials from partners/ suppliers.
- To participate in Innovation project(s) proposed by manager.
- To perform other tasks required by Manager.

* Stations Visits:
- To perform internal (physical & hidden) check.
- To provide guidance and coaching to Coffee barista to improve the quality of service at Café Bonjour.
- Ensure that the norm and guidelines for Café Bonjour are properly followed & implemented by partners.

* Order and Delivery:
- To coordinate order/ delivery of accessories or/and materials to different Café Bonjour outlets as required by dealers/ partners.
- To receive the delivery of items after the order and check quality.
- To deliver/send-off items (ex: coffee accessories) to various stations throughout the country.

* Reporting:
- To collect and prepare a monthly turnover report.
- To manage and coordinate other reports on the monthly & quarterly basis.
- To prepare additional reports as required.
Job Requirement:
- Educational background: Currently a bachelor’s degree student in relevant business field (possessing a basic knowledge about coffee would be a plus).
- Skill: Capability to communicate and write in English, Fast learner & willingness to learn new skill in an ever-changing job, Willingness to travel for the job, if required, Good communication & open-minded person.
- Knowledge: Ability to use Microsoft office’s software
- Language: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking.
- Period of intern: 6 months up to 1 year with monthly allowance provided

Manage daily front office operations, ensuring customer service     satisfaction. 2.  Ensure that reservation hotline is attended to at all times to     meet daily business needs. 3.  Respond to reservation request from residents, agency agents,     and referral networks made through various communication     platforms. 4. Job Description: JOB TITLE:    PROJECT CONSTRUCTION MANAGERREPORTS TO:   MANAGING DIRECTORLOCATION:     PHNOM PENHSALARY RANGE: NEGOTIABLE1.  Communicate and work closely with contractors and internal teams     in site safety, construction schedules, Work place safety,     environmental and waste management.2.  Coordinate the overall negotiation process, including     negotiation and closing of deals with contractors.3.  Monitor machine and equipment installation and ensure     specifications of the equipment comply with quality standards     and agreement.4.  Monitor delivery status of equipment and ensure installation is     within timeline, budget and project schedule.5.  Work closely with construction team and related departments on     the placement of equipment, supply storage, etc. 6.  Manage the overall performance of the project team and provide     training and development on work and safety Procedures /     guidelines.7.  Assist in the development, review, and update of site safety and     health analysis and ensure that all safety, environmental and     quality policies and practices are understood and complied by     contractors. 8.  Supervise site engineers to ensure efficient and smooth     construction operation, including construction scheduling,     coordination and throughput monitoring.9.  Provide reliability input into maintenance procedures, standards     and specifications.10. Participate in technical investigations, studies, problem     review, new and proposed equipment, materials, processes and     facilities and provide sound engineering evaluations and     recommendations for proposed actions.11. Perform other related duties as assigned.
Job Requirement: 1.  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, MEP engineering or a related     field. Master’s degree is preferred.2.  Minimum 5 years of experience in construction project.3.  In-depth knowledge and understanding of construction materials,     structural projects, etc. 4.  Knowledge of construction methods and strategies.5.  Knowledge of project management and risk management.6.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the     ability to communicate professionally with contractors,     customers, managers and employees at all level.7.  Ability to identify risks and mitigate forthcoming conflicts or     unacceptable business outcomes.8.  Ability to think creatively, innovatively and strategically.9.  Strong analytical, planning and organizing skills.

Job Description: JOB TITLE:    SENIOR QUANTITY SURVEYOR AND COST CONTROLLERREPORTS TO:   QUANTITY SURVEYOR MANAGERLOCATION:     PHNOM PENHSALARY RANGE: NEGOTIABLE1. Procurement: - Daily direct control and make purchase request from projects    site. - Extract bill of quantity from drawing and check specification for    material code in order to make purchase request. - Tracking record all purchases request from projects to PO Team - Check and report materials delivery on stock and site - Follow up contractor materials submission for approval2. Cost Management - Extract bill of quantity and pricing from supplier and contractor - Manage daily progress site report before process claim and submit    report to manager - Control and make tracking record for claim management with    accountant and legal team. - Selecting and evaluation contractor quotation and comparison. - Check and review project progress claim and interim payment    certificate from contractor.3. Quality control - Develop and control QA/QC form and implement to project site - Review and involved site inspection to check the quality of work    with punching list or defect list, - Check and review the submission material approval from contractor - Develop a standard formula for quantity take off with coding and    its correct methodology.
Job Requirement: 1. Bachelor’s degree in QS, Construction Management, Civil Engineering,    Architecture or a related field. Master’s degree would be an advantage.2. Worked at least 5 years in the construction industry including at least 3    years as a QS role.3. Ability to use MS Office (particularly Excel), AutoCAD.4. Ability to use QS related software such as Revit, CostX is a plus.5. Attention to detail.

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  023862111 hr@ftb.com.kh Phnom Penh Building No. 33 C-D, Tchecoslovaquie Blvd (169), Sangkat Veal Vong, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 023862111

Job Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree or MBA in Management, Communication, Education, or related field.At least 3-year experiences in related training and development field and plus 2 year experiences as training manager.Track record in designing and executing successful training programsFamiliarity with traditional and modern training methods (mentoring, coaching, on-the-job or in classroom training, e-learning, workshops, simulations etc.)Good organizational skill, time management, and team building.A strong desire to work in a team and deal with challenges.Good negotiation and internal & external relationship building.High initiative, commitment, good communication and problem solving skills.Computer literacy and English language proficiency.

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. position: Officer, Digital Bill Pay Support Unit
Job Description: Work on biller onboarding on system including SIT, UAT, and Pilots.Provide technical and operation support on any issue from consumer and biller.Track and monitor bill payment project progress, ensure effective implementation of new biller and perform post-implementation review after launch.Identify test system issues, Troubleshoot problem reporting and communicate to appropriate team members. Analyst the issue then forward to specific technical team for the fixed.Provide training and carry out testing to ensure alignment with business requirements, processes, and key operational controls.Prepare bill payment performance report to management and internal stakeholders.Support and create required documents to improve current and new system.Develop payment service and solution (API, Web service) to support business requirement.Other tasks assigned by the management.
Job Requirement: Bachelor degree in computer science, IT or equivalent.One year of experience in a financial institution and/or software support.Experience or knowledge in application programing.Fast learner, innovative, abilities in problem-solving, willingness to learn new things, team work spirit, and work under pressing situation.Good communication skills, you should be able to explain technical scenario’s to a non-technical product owner.Good computer literacy in good English speaking, writing, and reading.
Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of

Job Description: Assist to analyse FTB’s financial statements.Assist to monitor key financial risks and make sure FTB is fully complied with internal limit and NBC’s requirement.Assist to develop financial risk policies, procedures, and guidelines.Assist to anticipate and analyse prevailing market and financial trends at any particular period.Assist to assess all related risks by conducting financial researches.Assist to develop a framework and programs/tools to analyse financial risk such as liquidity risk, interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, and capital adequacy ratio for proper risk assessment.Assist ALCO in conducting stress test scenarios.Assist ALCO in analysing counter party risk.Assist to establish reports, summaries, and presentations, and process documents to display results of the financial risk assessment.Protect the Bank’s assets and public image.Assist in the development of strong risk management team.Assist to build and maintain good relationship with all decision makers regarding key clients.Other tasks assigned by the management.
