Job Description: • Prepares selection of Project Consultants• Briefs all Consultants on the client’s requirements and coordinates with the Lead Consultant and his team on the Design and other technical matters.• Conducts Client-Consultant Meetings and ensures flow of documentation/information is controlled.• Prepares the Development Schedule for the Project.• Reviews with Consultant QS on Cost Plans for Project with updates.• Liaises with Consultants on the provision of documents for the various submissions to authorities to ensure timely approval according to schedule.• Coordinates with Consultants to ensure calling and the award of tenders for various packages is done according to schedule and with the proper documentations and monitor the tendering process and tendering evaluation.• Establishes the contract administration procedures.• Prepares the Project Quality Plan and disseminates to Consultants, Contractors and Supervising Staff.• Monitors the Contractors ‘submissions and comments/replies by Construction Manager/Consultants• Ensures various critical milestones are incorporated in the Contractors’ programmes and are executed accordingly and to proper procedures.• Keeps track of the issued and potential variation orders and other controls to ensure that the project completes within budget.• Checks all payment claims by contractors and recommends for approval/payment.• Prepares monthly reports on site progress and other pertinent issues to the Employer.• Monitors various quality/safety control measures on site. Keeps tracks that all regulatory requirements to be adhered to by Contractors are followed.• Conducts regular meetings with Contractors on progress and other matters.• Ensures all procedures of handing over are complied with according to authorities and the Client’s requirements.• Monitors feedback on defects after handing over and the execution of the rectification works to address the complaints/defects.
Job Requirement: • Good attitude and energy level• Good communication• Good in budget planning• Good in management skill• Fluency English and other language is a plus• Proven experience as Project Manager or relevant role• Demonstrable competency in strategic project planning• Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics• Working knowledge of IT/Business infrastructure and MS Office• Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities• Excellent interpersonal and public speaking skills• Aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving• BSc in Engineering; MSc/MBA is a plus• Company condition:• + Working days: Monday – Saturday• + Working hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM• + Lunch time 12 PM – 1 PM• + Public holiday complies labor law• + Annual Leaves and Sick leaves• + Salary: Negotiate + Allowance• 📍Location: D'Seaview, Block A, A-05-01, St 115, Phum 1, Sangkat 3, Krong Preah Sihanouk, Cambodia• If you are interested, please submit your CV @ helenp@jeweladevelopment.com

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of

Job Description:
This role is responsible for servicing the clients who come to the branch counter. The incumbent will build a thorough understanding of each client financial requirements and will focus on providing best services to retain and build deeper relationships with clients.

Main Duties

•	Process banking transaction for the customers following FTB service standards
•	Act as a key advocate to existing and potential customers
•	Proactively determine customer’s need to actively sell the bank’s full range of product and services
•	Keep update on product knowledge and policies
•	Ensure transactional processing is efficient and accurate 
•	Assist others where needed
Job Requirement:
Skills/ Experiences

•	Bachelor Degree in Banking or related field
•	One year experience in customer service, cashier/teller with banking/MFIs 
•	Strong customer service and sales-oriented personality
•	Good organizational and time management skills
•	A strong desire to work in a team 
•	English language proficiency, Chinese language is a plus
•	Computer literacy in Microsoft Office Word & Excel
How to Apply:
Interested applicants, please send by email attached with a cover letter and your most updated CV (with current photo) to: hr@ftbbank.com or submit the hard copy at Our Head Office, Building No. 33 C-D, Tchecoslovaquie Blvd(169), Sangkat Veal Vong, Khan 7Makara Phnom Penh. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for interview.
Please visit our website: http://www.ftbbank.com/vacant-and-career for more available vacancy

FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. Job Description: •	Implement and manage service catalogue for all our business applications.•	Assist to develop and implement robust application support procedures/processes.•	Monitor applications through auto alerts and dashboards.•	Assist to develop/implement business continuity action plan for digital applications under digital banking department.•	Support the implementation/enhancements of new and existing applications through projects, business requirements and third party upgrades.•	Cooperate with product owner(s) in design and development of new and changed systems and services to improve customer experience and optimize operational efficiency.•	Collaborate with the other entities under the bank in development, testing, project management etc., to support different business demands.•	Prepare plans/schedules/resources for application maintenance.•	Perform any other tasks assigned by department head or senior management.

Job Description:
- Development:  Design and implement new functionalities using 
  JAVA/JEE technologies around Spring and Hibernate 
  frameworks, and rest services.
- Security: Design and implement an authentication and a 
  security system for distributed services and web application 
  which includes the use of a security frameworks, and 
  defensive programming.
- Optimization: Analyze a bottleneck in the software based on 
  memory and bandwidth consumption, and running-time of the 
  software, optimize and tune up to maximize the performance 
  of the software.
- UX design: Drive multi-devices (computer, tab and mobile) 
  design efforts, across browsers using Vaadin framework for 
  users.
- UX design: Use also HTML, JavaScript, CSS languages for web 
  design.
- Project: Participate to the full stack of the Software 
  Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Job Requirement:
- Must have strong back end development/analysis/debugging 
  skills in JEE, Core Java, Design patterns, and query 
  languages: SQL and JPA.
- Must have a strong knowledge of back-end tier: Service and 
  Persistence layers around SPRING/STRUTS/MVC, and Hibernate 
  or other ORM frameworks, and Rest Service framework with 
  Jersey or other similar frameworks.
- Experience with JDK 8 - with the knowledge of Lambda, 
  Generic, and Design patterns (MVP/MVC, Dependency 
  Injection).

Job Description:
1. Implementing Marketing Strategies and Plan
• Responsible for developing and setting target for annual quarterly and monthly marketing and sale plan for the resort.
• Lead the team with  clear understanding of the business strategies then set goals and to determine action plans to meet those goals.
• Implements all marketing and sales action plans related to my market areas as outlined in the marketing and sale plan.
• Design product pricing and ready to communicate with corporate customers
• Update action plans and financial objectives monthly and quarterly.
• Identify new markets and business opportunities and increase sales.

2. Representation and Implementation
• Direct team for daily sales calls and arrange site inspection trips to/for corporate clients.
• Represent resort in various events and exhibition.
• Executes and supports the operational aspects of business booked (e.g. CVGR, generating proposal, Corporate Rate Application letter,  writing contract, customer correspondence). 
• Able to provide Quick and timely responses, immediate communication to the properties, develop professional long term business relationships.
• Provide the highest quality of service to the customer at all times. 
• Able to supports hotels service and relationship strategy, driving customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience.
• Work closely with other Managers to ensure proposed rate negotiations meet the financial needs of the resort.
• Develop strong relationships with other team to ensure working in unity and always striving to achieve the same goals.
• Accompany sales team on sales calls to potential clients to assist in development of the account and to access the effectiveness and sales skills of the sales person.
• Assess additional training needs based on data gathered and interaction with marketing and sales team.
• Attending all department and meetings as necessary.
• Builds and strengthens relationships with existing and new customers to enable future bookings. Activities include sales calls, entertainment, trips, trade shows, etc.
• Develops relationships within community to strengthen and expand customer base for sales opportunities.
• Manages and develops relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
• Closely following up on all business leads within a 24 hour response time line to clients. 

3. Prerequisites:
• Proven success in a similar role and environment.
• Empathy towards your customers and colleagues.
• Pride and attention to detail.
• Polished personal presentation with Warm, confident and hospitable personality.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor of in marketing and sale or related fields
• 2 to 3 years experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.
• Be willing to learn new thing
• Be a committed person
• Be willing to travel

How to Apply
For interested candidate, please submit CV and Cover Letter by :  
- Telegram: 092 993 988
- Email: sopanha.bou@gmail.com
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Description:
_Promote Amret products and brand name among targeted communities and potential customers for deposit, credit products and other financial services in assigned operating area with a view to delivering clear, transparent and accurate information to each customer.

_Train clients in targeted areas of financial planning and consult on credit matter to ensure quality payments.

_Understand and apply credit policies and processes including analysis of client business risk and environmental and social risk to achieve quantity and quality objectives.

_Monitor deposit performance regularly to ensure sales target achieved.

_Check loan repayment schedule daily to ensure reimbursements are on time along with following up disbursements to make sure that the status of clients is updated and any problems promptly solved.

_Provide services to customers based on good communication and ethical behavior.

_Build and maintain good relationships with prospects, customers and local authorities to ensure that customer satisfaction is enriched.

_Collect customer feedbacks and competitor information such as product/service features, pricing etc. in the purpose of providing constructive comments to direct supervisor for improvement.

_File documents and cash clearance records to ensure that daily transactions comply with credit, treasury and internal control policies and procedures.
Job Requirement:
_Associate degree or equivalent qualification in banking, finance, marketing or related field

_Non-experienced and experienced are encourage to apply

_Good verbal and written communication in both Khmer and English

_High commitment and able to work under pressure.
Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.

Company Profile:
About Smiling Gecko Cambodia:
In 2014, Smiling Gecko Cambodia (SGC) was officially registered as a local NGO in Cambodia. SGC is legally independent of Smiling Gecko Switzerland. Following its mission of «Cambodians help Cambodians», the organization provides direct aid to disadvantaged people in the country, supporting local job initiatives and promoting self-help among the rural population. Apart from providing direct aid and supporting other NGOs, Smiling Gecko, thus, focuses on fighting the causes of poverty and helping people to help themselves. To this end, SGC launched a project on a previously acquired site to the North of Phnom Penh whose objective is to provide several thousand Cambodians with future job training and a regular income in the sectors of agriculture, tourism, industry, and trade. In future, the proceeds are intended to cover the operating costs of the innovative pilot school, which is also part of the cluster and provides education to nearly 1,000 children (from preschool to senior high school).

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training

- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description: This role is to assist Actuarial Manager by (1) owning part of the regular actuarial report & analysis, (2) contributing to the reporting pipeline improvement project, (3) provide actuarial insight for strategic initiatives to achieve business objectives of the company.Roles and Responsibilities:      Long-term goal below:•Be the owner of one or more of the following BAU area (on a rotating basis with other team members):       o Operate / maintain / improve actuarial projection model in Prophet software to project company cash flow for decision making.       o Regular actuarial report & analysis, including calculation and trend explanation of reserve, solvency, embedded value, operating profit (OPAT), value of New Business (VONB), reinsurance, and persistency.       o Be the co-ordinator to plan and request info from other function, review the consistency of information provided to compose Quarterly / Monthly Management Report (QMR)       o Yearly business plan       o Yearly experience study. Perform analytic experience study to identify business opportunities issues (actual vs. expected mortality, expense, lapse...)       o Working with regulator• Contribute to the project “Reporting pipeline improvement”       o Set up Azure SQL database to store historical and current reporting (actual/target) data. Use T-SQL to automate any output requirement.       o Setup dashboard in Power BI to replace existing Excel-based report.       o Complete the addition of all products into the Prophet projection model.       o Build reinsurance admin system into Azure T-SQL, and integrate into local admin system       o Setup Python script to automate repeating process.       o Work with other functions to raise request, explain to system developer, and test the policy admin system to automate and streamline the reporting process (persistency calculation, policy data improvement…)• Provide actuarial support to adhoc strategic initiatives by distribution channel• And other tasks assigned by manager as the requirement arise.
Job Requirement: Communication Requirements Internal & External• (80% internal)Input request, project timeline, result presentation, UAT resultPeople contacted: Group Finance, Group Actuarial, Local Finance, Local Agency, Local PD, Local IT, Exco• (20% external) Submit & explain & analyze the resulting numbers.Auditor, MEF supervisor• Most challenging would be working with IT, the role needs to understand actuarial & finance concept and be able to explain clearly in non-technical terms so that IT can implement correctly on the IL system.• Education – Bachelor’s Degree Actuarial Science, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and other relevant disciplines preferred but not required• Experience – Prior experience in actuarial field is an advantage but not a must. Experienced candidate will be considered for Senior Analyst title. Candidates with little or no experience will be considered for Actuarial Analyst title.• Strong analytical & logical thinking• Good interpersonal communication in English & Khmer (both written & oral)• Be a team player• A sense of responsibility and ownership of the task assigned.• Desire to learn and improve

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

job title: Senior Officer, Business Performance and Reporting
position: Senior Officer, Business Performance and Reporting
Job Description:
- Provide timely and reliable reports related to project’s Construction Costs
- Variance analysis of Actual costs vs. BoQ and addressing the questions to the Project Management / Planning team and other stakeholders regarding abnormal spending and overbudgets
- Monitoring and Controlling of Construction Costs and overheads and addressing the issues to construction teams
- Provide insights of deviations and negative trends with proper action plan
- Financial Forecasting, developing Templates, establish timetable, prepare presentations with budgets 
- Assist in Standard Cost calculation
- Assist in Profitability by Projects preparation
- Collaborate and act as a business partner to stakeholders across organization
- Drive Efficiency and assist in Cost Optimization initiatives, 
- Spot checks at project sites
- Assist in developing BI tools and automation projects
Job Requirement:
- At least 1 year of experience in Accounting or Finance.
- Experience in FP&A in Real Estate Business is an advantage
- Knowledge of accounting principles and/or finance.
- Experience in financial modeling
- Experience in SAP (preferable) or other ERP system
- Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint user
- Experience in Power BI is an advantage
- Analytical and numerical skills with the ability to interpret raw data and translate it into clear, concise information
- Strong presentation skills
- Ability to explain complex financial data to non-finance individuals
- Ability to see the ‘bigger picture’
- Self-motivated / driven
- Collaborative and communicative
- Organized, responsive, able to work under pressure and to focus on delivering results

Job Description:
Summary of Position
Identify sales prospects and execute sales transactions. Maintain good relationships with clients; provide support to customers to ensure that products are safely delivered on time. Collect data and provide recommendations for market improvements.

What you will do:
•	Monitor and control individual sales to achieve yearly target assigned by supervisor
•	Visit clients and potential clients in the assigned areas to evaluate needs or promote products and services
•	Build good relationship with the potential sales outlets and other trade factors
•	Provide good quality products and services to customers through communication with all parties
•	Complete credit proposal form with relevant documents and recommend ensuring that debts are monitored and collected following credit terms
•	Understand market trends by collecting all market information and suggestions to improve sales
•	Resolves customer complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports, and making recommendations to management
•	Perform other duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
What you should have:
•	High School and above (bachelor’s degree is an advantage)
•	1-year experience in marketing, promotions, advertising sales, or business administration preferred
•	Knowledge of related specific products is a plus
•	Highly self-motivated
•	Strong verbal and written communication skills
•	Able to travel within the assign area and holding a driving license is a plus
•	Customer service
•	Good negotiation skill
•	Presentation skill
•	Attention to detail

What we offer:
We offer attractive remuneration and fringe benefits including free meals, Seniority payment, bonus, and insurance, etc. with excellent career development opportunities to the right candidates.

More Information:
•	Recruiter: Chansavat Hak
•	Telegram/Tel: 067 222 949
•	Address: #137, Mao Tse Tung Blvd. Khan Chamkamorn, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
•	Website: http://www.chipmong.com

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. In recent years, Chip Mong has experienced tremendous growth and evolved into one of the largest groups of companies in the country, comprising seven wholly-owned subsidies, three joint-ventures, and two hotel projects. Chip Mong’s businesses include construction and materials, consumers goods, property development, beverages, general industrials, hospitality, retail and feed. The Company also offers a vast array of consumer products from well-known manufacturers throughout the region.
Contact Info: Contact Information Vandy KEO  067 222 949 vandy.keo@chipmong.com #137, Mao Tse Tung Blvd, Sangkat Boeung Keng Kang III, Khan Chamkarmorn, Phnom Penh Cambodia 067 222 949

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
- Support and lead the company event with marketing manager. 
- Contributes information, ideas, and research to help develop marketing strategies
- Helps to detail, design, and implement marketing plans for each product or service being offered
- Sets marketing schedules and coordinates with colleagues, sponsors, media representatives, and other professionals to implement strategies across multiple channels
- Develops sales strategies and approaches for various products and services, such as special promotions, sponsored events, etc.
- Analyses trends, data, demographics, pricing strategies, and other information that can potentially improve marketing and sales performance
- Assigns specific employees to marketing and sales projects or client accounts as needed
- Attends trade shows and travels to meet clients as needed

Benefits:

- Public Holiday: Follow the government
- Insurance Covered: Health & Accident 24hrs (Worldwide)

- Internal & External Training on Skills

- Ability to develop marketing planning, market survey and working procedure 
- Have a good communication, interpersonal skill, influencing skills, hardworking, and honesty
- Good knowledge in English both written and verbal communication
- Good knowledge of computer applications MS office, Internet, Email & Outlook
- Be able to work under pressure, tight timeline, strong Interpersonal skill

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description: * Strategy and Planning- Initiate, define, plan, communicate and follow up company's   business strategy regarding Private Banking business in order   to ensure company’s long-term viability and market share.- Develop an appropriate marketing plan with marketing team to   efficiently and effectively achieve goals and objectives   through design and implement workable and innovative   solutions for client’s needs.- Keep abreast of latest market trend, analyze customers'   behavior, key financial drivers and competitors'' strategy to   sustain a continuous service growth.* Customer Acquisition & Revenue Target- Present and provide highly professional consultations to   target corporate clients and HNWI to address their demands   and match with the Bank’s products and services.- Discuss credit-related issues and loan packaging to provide   sound financial advice and tailored solutions for the clients   as well as to take the opportunity to cross-sell other   banking products.- Prepare and execute loan contracts and arrange loan   disbursement timely and accurately to fulfill clients’ needs   and satisfactions.- Closely monitor on recommended/processed loan for timely   repayment and to ensure Portfolio at Risk remains within   acceptable level.- Solicit, build and maintain new and existing local   corporate/HNW individual clients in accordance with the   guidelines stated in the Commercial Banking policies and   procedures to ensure sustainable and secure deposit and loan   portfolios and expending scope to investment and other   products/services as cross-selling.* Customer Relationship Management- Make regular site visits to existing clients to determine the   actual conditions of the business and loan collateral whether   it should remain the same or be downgraded as well as to   develop relationship with clients as part of retention   strategies.- Act as liaison between clients and internal operations team   to timely and effectively understand and provide all types of   banking products including but not limited to deposits,   loans, trade finances and remittance for the clients.- Handle complex clients’ issues or complaints to find an   amicable solution for all and process to higher authority if   needed.* Project Management & Process Improvement- Lead projects on developing and launching new   initiatives/services and creating new service features and   process regarding Private Banking as needed to improve/gain   market penetration/share- Coordinate with different departments, including Operations,   Finance & IT in streamlining processes, Marketing to drive   business growth and Risk and Compliance in ensuring adherence   of relevant policies and guidelines.* Staff Management- Supervise staff in daily tasks, operations and quality   control.- Coordinate available resources for maximum outcomes.- Act as a role model within the team to question, listen and   give actionable feedback carefully in order to create a   productive work atmosphere towards “speak up culture”.- Oversee Deposit Initiatives such as new product development,   feature enhancements, client experience improvement, pricing   management, campaign/promotion to support deposit raising   etc. in their entire lifecycle from client value proposition   conception, tech budgetary negotiation & planning, product   approval/approval, project management and risk/control   governance etc- Oversee day-to-day deposits product management across all   markets including review/approval of deposit campaigns   (tactical, bundles, solus, thematic, digital focused, etc.),   monthly deposit reviews with markets, weekly deposit balance   monitoring and flash process, month-end revenue analysis, and   annual Plan and mid-year forecast exercise.
Job Requirement: - BA in Business, Economics, Accounting, Banking or Finance- Minimum 3 years' experience in Sales & Customers or Partners   Relationship Management / Business Analysis / Project   Management / Transformation / Digital , preferably gained in   Banking or Financial Services industry or consultancy and in   particular in Corporate, Retail Banking, Banking and Cash   Management, Lending / Investment is a plus- Good in spoken / written English and in another foreign   language is a plus- Strong customer/partner relationship, customer services and   deal/project structuring/implementation- Good analytical, communication and interpersonal skills- Having high level of confidentiality, integrity and business   ethic

Job Description:
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
• To organise and distribute tasks and positions to each member of the team.
• To communicate actively with the team, according to requirements.
• To ensure a good level of customer service in the team.
• To participate in the recruitment of store personnel and learn to do it on your own.
• To actively collaborate in the correct integration of all new employees
• To detect the potential of each employee and mentor them in their development.
• To support with the effective management of personnel administration duties.
• To monitor and ensure the correct personal and professional image of the team.
• Wherever necessary, to manage potential conflict in the correct manner.
• To ensure compliance with the regulations and the legislation.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
• To actively participate in planning the required measures in order to meet targets.
• To analyse management indicators and costs in order to improve them.
• To continuously monitor sales and customer service.
• During busy periods, to dedicate time to direct selling alongside the team.
• To supervise and apply administrative procedures according to the internal regulations.
• To apply all instructions received (HQ, supervisor, etc.) and report on them (if necessary).
• To carry out strict supervision of the entire cash desk procedure.
• To participate in the optimisation of internal resources and try to minimise expenses e.g.
optimisation of the workforce, suppliers, etc.
• To communicate and pass on any information that may affect sales.

PRODUCT AND MERCHANDISING
• To be familiar with the collection and maximise sales (initial order, entries, etc.).
• To participate in the implementation of Merchandising standards.
• To know the profitability of the store and furniture displays in order to maximise sales.
• To be familiar with and apply the replenishing standards of the store.
• To respect and monitor compliance with merchandising and furniture display guidelines.
• To produce stylings, silhouettes and combinations on a regular basis.
• To control and manage stock (both in transit and in the stockroom) and inventories.
• To ensure the correct end of season return (inventories).
• To ensure compliance with the store image, maintenance and window dressing standards.
• To provide product feedback (his/hers and customers’).
Job Requirement:
• Basic knowledge of the business indicators.
• Customer Service Standard and Service Policy.
• Knowledge of the collection and awareness of fashion.
• Merchandising Standards.
• Cash register programme and Pathfinder operation.
• Internal regulations and some knowledge of employment legislation.
• Product awareness and commercial orientation.
• Organisation, management and planning.
• Able to analyse and offer solutions.
• A motivator with leadership qualities.
• Communicative and persuasive.
• Customer and image-oriented.
• Ability to adapt – energy and speed.
• Is enthusiastic, friendly, cordial and polite.
• Shows initiative and decision-making/problem-solving ability.
• Acts quickly and is multi-disciplinary.
• Self-motivating and self-critical.
Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Chin Panha  N/A kh-hr@jpsfashions.com Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall N/A

Job Description:
•	Works with Users, Business Project Managers, IT Support Team, IT PMO, Finance, Commercial and other stakeholders to understand their needs and requirements and tailor appropriate solutions.
•	Perform data updates, indexing, and maintenance in application Data warehouse and ETL tools. 
•	Work with Business Owners/Data Analyst to develop key business questions and to build datasets that answer those questions.
•	Help to implement new data management projects and re-structure of the current data architecture.
•	Assist team in data management projects when needed.
•	Process and load third party data sources.
•	Work with Business Customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions.
•	Identify and solve issues concerning data management to improve data quality.
•	Develop best practices for data management, maintenance, reporting and security.
•	Improve data foundational procedures, guidelines and standards.
•	Review dataset implementations performed by other data engineers.
•	Perform additional data and database related tasks.
•	Learn new technology if require
•	Resolve tickets on Web Helpdesk
Job Requirement:
•	(The minimum education, experience, knowledge, skills & attitude required to perform the position)
•	Education: Bachelor Degree in Information Technology
•	Experience: at least 2 year experiences in Data warehouse, ETL tools, Data processing, Hive, Spark, Kafka, …. 
•	Skills: Data structure, coding, Machine learning, Data warehouse, ETL, Data integration
•	Knowledge: data structure, programming, big data, database (Oracle, Postgres), business concept
•	Attitude: active, hard-working, honest, responsibility, friendly

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh Phnom Penh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Company Profile: Urban Hub Cambodia is a multi-award-winner and one of Cambodia’s biggest fully licensed real estate developers. We are committed to developing projects that provide the new generations of Cambodia with exceptional modern living and experience of the first world that focuses on “LIVE, WORK, PLAY” yet preserving the Cambodian tradition and identity of community living.Registered in 2017, Urban Hub Cambodia is a joint venture between a Hong Kong-based conglomerate, Goldfame Group, the largest Hong Kong investor in Cambodia since 1992, and a Cambodian-American real estate company, Urban Living Solutions. Urban Hub Cambodia has quickly become a leading mixed-use property developer and the first developer ever from Cambodia to win the most awards including two major regional awards, “Best Condo Development in Asia 2019” and “Best Co-working Space in Asia 2020” at Asia’s longest-running and most respected property awards organized by PropertyGuru. Urban Hub Cambodia is behind the four most award-winning Cambodian projects both locally and regionally, including Urban Loft, Factory Phnom Penh, Urban Village Phase 1, and Urban Village Phase 2. More projects are expected in the near future.

Job Description: The main purpose of the “Officer, Fraud Analytic” position is responsible for implementation of fraud investigation or analytic transaction to find a case of suspected or possible fraud/corruption of varying nature in Hattha Bank’s business operation and making recommendations about future measures by interviewing witnesses, complainants, staff and research transactions and records to presents investigation results. This role assists the Supervisor to identify of control weaknesses and implementing and controls for future improvements.Location Head Office, Phnom PenhDuties and Responsibilities.Analyze the transactions or conduct off-site of the alert suspicious report from Hattha Bank fraud detection system. .Prepare off-site report for management and others stake holder. .Communicate with relevant stakeholder/branch manager to addressing the suspicious transactions/actions for effectiveness of providing fraud investigation service..Identify the risk of fraud area around Hattha’s activities and set priority to find the fraud case..Perform other task as assigned by supervisor or management.
Job Requirement: .Bachelor degree in the field of financial banking, Business Management or Economics or others related field..Working knowledge/understanding of risk management/ measurement techniques..Highly acquainted with computer system, program such as MS. Word/Excel/Power Point, email, internet and core banking system..Understanding of financial/banking business operation..Work experience in different areas of the institution or bank at least 1 year related to Banks and Financial Institutions, including experience in field of risk management, audit and fraud function would be an advantage..Ability to maintain good relationships with both internal and external parties.
Company Profile:
Hattha Bank is a leading bank in Cambodia, licensed by National Bank of Cambodia. Having been operating for more than 26 years with MDI status in the market, with its rapidly success, Hattha Bank has transformed its status from MDI to commercial bank in 2020, and continue providing diversified financial services to individual and SME businesses; and jump into retail consumer financial market and corporate customer in urbanities.

Hattha Bank is a subsidiary of Bank of Ayudhya (Krungsri), the fifth largest commercial bank in Thailand, and a member of MUFG Bank, the Japan’s largest banking group, and one of the largest and most diversified financial groups in the world.

job title: Senior Sales/ Sales Manager  ( Vertical & FMCG)
position: Senior Sales/ Sales Manager  ( Vertical & FMCG)
Job Description: OpportunityHas overall sales responsibility for customer relationships and performance of an assigned customer portfolio for a medium impact client base in any size cluster/geographical area.Key Responsibilities- Manage existing customers and develop new customers for both Ocean and Logistics services.- Create sufficient sales pipeline size.- Deliver volume, profit and customer base enlargement to meet and exceed targets.- Proactively participate in bidding, respond to quotation/business inquiry and initiate sales leads by coordinating input from internal involved stakeholders.- Establish business development plan to be aligned with company strategy and local industry environment.- Identifying customers’ need and design end-to-end integrated value-based solution.- Proactively engage internal cooperative departments to understand customers’ requirements. - Support operational implementation and handover once business has been landed.- Continuously improve customer satisfaction & retention and winning ratio of new opportunities.- Ensure contracts and agreements are validated and signed off as per corporate guidelines.

Strengths in managing multiple objectives and priorities.- Fluency in English and Khmer, Chinese speaking ability would be a plus.

job title: Senior Officer, Bancassurance for Operation - 01 post.
position: Senior Officer, Bancassurance for Operation - 01 post.
Job Description: The main purpose of the “Senior Officer, Bancassurance for Operation” position is responsible for supervising, managing and monitoring the daily operation of bancassurance business in Hattha Bank including procedure and process development, customer complaint handling, facilitate on operational risk assessment, developing marketing promotion and campaign, develop incentive program and ensure the bank comply with regulatory requirement.Location: Head Office, Phnom PenhDuties and Responsibilities•Facilitate line manager to develop the operational procedure of bancassurance.•Facilitate line manager to develop the customer complaint handling procedure of bancassurance.•Facilitate with cross functional team on process design to ensure its compliance with regulation, risk assessment.•Conduct the training on insurance referral process and facilitate the training on new insurance to operators.•Facilitate the preparation of the marketing strategy, promotional campaign, marketing activities, message communication to market to ensure the mislead communication.•Monitor the incentive program, sale campaign, performance bonus for staff to ensure the effectiveness of referral process.•Support, facilitate between branch, insurer on claim request, customer complaint, provide suitable solution for customers.•Responsible for regular settlement on the premium collection, commission, incentive, campaign with insurance company.•Prepare the UAT test case scenario and perform testing and system for new development and enhancement.•Prepare the monthly report and quarterly report for regulators.•Perform other task as assigned by supervisor or management.
Job Requirement: .Bachelor degree in finance and banking or business management, or related fields..At least 02 years experiences in insurance business industry..Prior other financial product management experience is preferred..Extensive knowledge in insurance products, analytical, quantitative, problem solving, communication (written and verbal), presentation, relationship management skills..Be proficient in English both speaking and writing..Be innovative, dynamic, and confident.
Company Profile:
Hattha Bank is a leading bank in Cambodia, licensed by National Bank of Cambodia. Having been operating for more than 26 years with MDI status in the market, with its rapidly success, Hattha Bank has transformed its status from MDI to commercial bank in 2020, and continue providing diversified financial services to individual and SME businesses; and jump into retail consumer financial market and corporate customer in urbanities.

Hattha Bank is a subsidiary of Bank of Ayudhya (Krungsri), the fifth largest commercial bank in Thailand, and a member of MUFG Bank, the Japan’s largest banking group, and one of the largest and most diversified financial groups in the world.

Job Description: OpportunityDrive growth opportunities for Contract Logistics (CL) products with a high level of commercial, technical/operational and market understanding. Enhance sales owners’ capabilities and knowledge, including increased confidence to profitably grow with the customer in Contract Logistics products and eventually integrated solutions. Identify business opportunities in the core and new verticals and stay ahead of market trends.Develop opportunities for CL fulfilment ProductsDevelop opportunities for Contract Logistics products brought forward by commercial teams.- Coordinate with solution team to provide pricing on opportunities brought forward by commercial teams.- Maximize synergies & overall profitability on opportunities.- Actively lead the RFI, RFQ and RFP process for Contract Logistics Product. Ensure RFQ & RFP proposals submitted are comprehensive, competitive and within the parameters set by global product.- Review and vet contracts ensuring product technical standards & requirements are met.- Support new business pursuits via our sales/internal stakeholders to deliver a sound business proposal on time.- Approach new leads jointly with relevant sales colleagues, transferring opportunity ownership to sales in line with sales accountability.- Strong ability to break down a product solution in a simplistic fashion to both internal sales and customers.- Support sales in pursuit of deals for relevant products (inbound marketing leads, trade shows, past relationships, etc.) Opportunity ownership sits with sales, not with business development. - Leading sales call for promotion of CL products capability to target customer, leveraging their product knowledge.- Increase knowledge & awareness of CL products with sales & internal stakeholders- Providing solutions to sales and customers at a rapid pace.Serve as a centre of excellence within the region for CL fulfilment Products.- Provide expertise for CL fulfilment products as a consultant to customers.- Provide expertise for CL fulfilment products as a consultant to internal stakeholders.- Ensure customer satisfaction within CL fulfilment products.- Act as the voice of the customers within CL product organization.
Job Requirement: - In-depth understanding of local/regional industry market trends.- Solid understanding of customer industry needs & requirements for the respective product.- Well-developed stakeholder management and influencing skills.- Strong understanding of the commercial solution sales process.- Strong financial & pricing acumen.- Deep Contract Logistics industry knowledge (3+ years) - selling and solutioning our core technical service offering.

Job Description: 1.Managing the contract administration policy,draft(as required),review with legal aspect comments,notarization,archiving of the contract/agreement, to smooth the contract approval process.2.Advise on a wide range of legal and regulatory matters pertaining to the air transport industry, including data privacy, and intellectual property etc.;support risk management/regulatory compliance, and  support staff.3.Handle claims and litigation, including passenger compensation and cross-border litigation and emergency events etc.if any.4.Manage external counsels,in each case with respect to KR.5.Any other tasks following departmentinstruction and be able to work independently with minimum supervision and as part of a department.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree or above; major: Law 
- Good English listening, speaking, reading and writing skills, able to conduct business communication in English;
- At least 05 years of relevant experience and skills applicable in litigation/arbitration procedures.
- Good character, patient and meticulous, strong sense of responsibility, strong communication skills and understanding.
Company Profile:
[CAMBODIA AIRWAYS – THE WINGS OF CAMBODIA]
Cambodia Airways Co., Ltd (IATA code KR, ICAO code KME) was registered in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with the registered capital of 200 million US dollars. Cambodia Airways completed the business registration in September 2017 and officially obtained the AOC certificate on July 6th, 2018. Our first commercial flight route between Phnom Penh and Siem Reap was commenced on July 10th, 2018. By the early of November 2019, Cambodia Airways has successfully launched routes from hub in Phnom Penh to Siem Reap & Sihanoukville for domestic flights and to Macao, Fuzhou, Wenzhou, Shenzhen Chengdu and Bangkok for international flights. The Cambodia Airways logo design is inspired by the Angkor Wat temple, which is an iconic structure in Cambodia and the largest monument of its kind in the world. A symbol of the temple appears on the national flag of the Kingdom of Cambodia and we are proud to bear it into the clouds, as representatives of our unique and beautiful nation.
Contact Info: Contact Information Chao Sunseng (Mr.) HR Manager 070520025 job@cambodia-airways.com #2, Russian Federation Blvd, Sangkat Ka Kab, Khan Por Senchey, Phnom Penh, Kingdom of Cambodia 070520025

job title: បុគ្គលិកផ្នែកលក់
position: បុគ្គលិកផ្នែកលក់
Job Description: បុគ្គលិកតំណាងផ្នែកលក់ លក់ផលិតផល ឬសេវាកម្មសម្រាប់ក្រុមហ៊ុន និងតំណាងឱ្យម៉ាកយីហោរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន។
Job Requirement:
1. ភារៈកិច្ច និងទំនួលខុសត្រូវ 
- ជំរុញសកម្មភាពលក់ និងទីផ្សារដើម្បីបំពេញគោលដៅលក់របស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន
- បង្ហាញប្រភេទនៃផលិតផលដល់អតិថិជន ទាំងតម្លៃ និងលក្ខខណ្ឌនៃការទិញផ្សេងៗ
- ស្វែងរកអតិថិជនគោលដៅអោយបានកាន់តែច្រើន ដោយការកសាងបណ្តាញទំនងទំនងជាមួយមនុស្សជុំវិញ និងរក្សាទំនាក់ទំនងល្អជាមួយអតិថិជនដែលមានស្រាប់
- ចរចាតម្លៃ និងលក្ខខណ្ឌជាមួយអតិថិជន និងផ្តល់ព័ត៌មានថ្មីៗដល់ថ្នាក់គ្រប់គ្រង
- សម្របសម្រួលជាមួយនាយកដ្ឋានបច្ចេកទេស ក្នុងករណីមានការណែនាំផ្សេងៗពីអតិថិជន
- រាយការណ៍ពីការលក់ប្រចាំខែរបស់ខ្លូន និង​តម្រូវការរបស់អតិថិជនដល់ប្រធានផ្នែកលក់ ដើម្បីស្វែងរកយុទ្ធសាស្រ្តថ្មីៗជំរុញការលក់
- ចូលរួមក្នុងព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ ដូចជាការចែករំលែកខិតប័ណ្ណ និងព័ត៌មានផ្សេងៗអំពីផលិតផល
- ចូលរួមគោរពតាមបទបញ្ជា និងវិន័យផ្ទៃក្នុងរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនអោយបានម៉ឺងម៉ាត់
- ភារកិច្ចផ្សេងៗ ដ៏ទៃទៀតត្រូវបានចាត់តាំងដោយថ្នាក់គ្រប់គ្រង
2. លក្ខណៈ​សម្បត្តិ
- ប្រលងជាប់ថ្នាក់ទី១២ ឬធ្លាក់ថ្នាក់ទី១២ក៏បាន
- មានបទពិសោធន៍ការងារយ៉ាងតិច ១ឆ្នាំ ផ្នែកលក់
- មានការទំនាក់ទំនង និងពាក្យសំដីល្អ និងភាពរួសរាយរាក់ទាក់
- ចេះលើកទឹកចិត្តខ្លួនឯង និងអាចធ្វើការបានក្រោមបរិយាកាសផ្សេងៗ

We are committed to developing projects that provide the new generations of Cambodia with exceptional modern living and experience of the first world that focuses on “LIVE, WORK, PLAY” yet preserving the Cambodian tradition and identity of community living.Registered in 2017, Urban Hub Cambodia is a joint venture between a Hong Kong-based conglomerate, Goldfame Group, the largest Hong Kong investor in Cambodia since 1992, and a Cambodian-American real estate company, Urban Living Solutions. More projects are expected in the near future.

company_name: TAING CHENG OING CONSTRUCTION & IMPORT EXPORT CO., LTD.
Job Description:
•	Performs diversified accounting and tax assignments under the direction of the Manager 
•	Prepares personal, corporate, partnership, and TCO returns of increasing complexity.
•	Responds to tax notices of any sort and prepares initial drafts of letters required.
•	Prepares tax accruals as may be required in preparing corporate tax returns.
•	Participates in tax planning and projections.
•	Interact with business unit personnel to facilitate tax compliance and reporting and assist in tax computations.
•	Support junior tax professionals with day-to-day guidance.
•	Assist with data collection from internal departments and divisions to satisfy compliance needs.
•	Assist with research and completion of tax notices and tax audits.
•	Propose and develop procedures to improve processes related to tax filings.
•	Research tax issues, prepare and/or review memos to document conclusions. 
•	Interact and develop relationships with business unit staff to facilitate tax compliance and reporting and analyze tax impact of business decisions.
•	Scan and file any information used to prepare tax filings.
•	Calculate, prepare, and review percentage of completion tax computations.
•	Work with internal departments to collect data necessary to prepare government tax 
•	Gather documentation and prepare tax calculations in support from the manager
•	Assist in calculation and review of state income tax credit adjustments.
•	Assist in tax provision preparations.
•	Responsible for analyzing and supporting income tax filing positions.
•	Analyze tax law changes and implications to company business.
•	Make recommendations for data gathering and analysis in support of current tax law.
•	Other activities, duties, and responsibilities as assigned.
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field and 5 years in corporate tax.
•	Construction industry experience preferred
•	Supervisory/management of small team preferred
•	Excellent knowledge of tax and accounting principles to ensure timely and accurate reporting
•	Remain current in applicable tax laws to offer and implement suggestions to improve overall operations
•	Apply critical thinking to manage through complex decisions and judgments
•	Ability to manage activities, requests, and short-cycle deadlines simultaneously
•	Able to observe performance and effectively provide performance feedback
•	Knowledge of financial system applications, advanced knowledge of MS Excel and MS Word
•	Self-motivated, adaptable and flexible to operate with minimal direction and little or no supervision while working in complex and changing environment
•	Lead by example and set standards for performance and behavior; act with integrity and professionalism, strong dedication to teamwork
•	Professional written and verbal communication skills
•	High degree of organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail
Company Profile:
TCO Constructions & Import Export Co., Ltd (TCO) is a one of the largest and well recognized construction company in Cambodia. Established in 2004, with clients ranging from well-known international organization such as The World Bank, ADB, other International Agencies to local companies as well as different Cambodia Government Ministries, TCO has provided Hight quality construction services specializing in road, railway, bridge, building, ports, irrigation, water treatment plant and drainage systems.

We are passionate about what we do and our partners’ success. We pride ourselves on being a quality and reputable solution provider in Cambodia for infrastructure development construction projects.  With our expansion plan, we are seeking an experienced and Competent individual to joint our company.

job title: Technical Manager (1 post, Expat or Local) 1,800$ - 2,500$
company_name: TAING CHENG OING CONSTRUCTION & IMPORT EXPORT CO., LTD.
position: Technical Manager (1 post, Expat or Local) 1,800$ - 2,500$
Job Description:
Location: Head Office, Phnom Penh, with site visits to provinces from time to time

a.	Co-ordination:
•	Take control of all aspects of the design to ensure that current information is available to whenever need it within a pre-agreed programme. The information must be clear, accurate and coherent and the designs must be as economic and practical as possible.
•	Ensure the consultants are briefed on the required distribution of drawing information and also key dates when information is required to meet our procurement requirements.
•	Ensure regular Design Team meetings, at early stage of design development, occur with the relevant consultants.
•	Check new site information prior to committing to working drawing stage.
•	Assess the planning information for obvious building regulation requirements such as means of escape, unprotected areas, underground ventilation and other given criterion at an earlier stage.
•	Instruct the design team to produce full working drawings for the new sites and agree a programme of works, once authorised by the Project Director.
•	Look at layouts at a very early stage for optimization.
•	Deal with payment issues which arise with consultants.
b.	Post Planning Permission
•	Take over and instigate the selection of materials for the buildings as indicated on the working drawing and on a plot-by-plot basis at an early stage.
•	Help ensure a rapid clearance of all planning conditions including the submission of materials. Special emphasis to be placed on clearance prior to commencement conditions as a priority. 
•	Ensure Planning Condition Tracking Schedule is issued to relevant parties as the scheme progresses.
•	Ensure a schedule of all conditions is produced and then make sure it is monitored by technical on submissions and approvals.
c.	Working Drawings and Detailed Design
•	Formally appoint all consultants in line with approved Group consultant appointment documents. 
•	Monitor Professional Indemnity policies and ensure that appropriate cover is maintained for relevant run off period.
•	Agree with the consultant a schedule of information required for the groundwork's superstructure and detail packages. This will allow sites to start early with budgets set for groundworkers.
•	Agree on a programme for final issue of information and within the overall time from dates for receipt of partial formation.
•	Ensure that a senior person at the consultants has checked all information sent out even if it is partial information.
•	Check incoming information from the consultants and ensure any comments are fed back.
•	Ensure that architectural and engineering drawings tie up.
•	Ensure that subsequent changes necessary to design after permission has been granted are communicated through to the Planning Department as minor amendments.
•	Ensure the drawing package is acceptable in terms of accuracy and drawing style presentation.
•	Ensure that a site specific construction specification is issued.
•	Produce, with relevant consultants, a strategy for Code for Sustainable Homes where applicable.
•	Check and ensure that specialist manufactures details tie up with working drawings. Also, for Design Teams to approve drawings early to keep production on-going.
•	Ensure any bin stores/cycle stores/external stores/ sub stations are properly positioned and detailed.
•	Ensure correct details of the following are obtained, checked and issued in conjunction with the Commercial Department, including the enabling the checking and dimensional co-ordination together with the suitability to the construction wholly or in conjunction with the consultants. 
•	Ensure the Conveyance Plan is checked/issued to relevant parties and amended where necessary.
•	Ensure drawings are issued correctly and in time whenever needs them.
d.	General
•	Take a wider interest in the Company. 
•	Improve areas where changes are needed.
•	Research new products, innovations and techniques.
•	Look for savings and efficiency at all times.
•	Keep up with new statutory requirements.
•	Liaise with staff and deal with issues as necessary. Also keep President/Vice President/Project Director informed of any matters which need addressing.
e.	Meetings
•	Attend the following meetings where required: -
a)	Build Technical Meeting
b)	Site Meeting
c)	Weekly meeting
d)	Design Team Meeting
e)	Drawing Check Meetings with Construction Department
f)	Pre-commencement Meeting
g)	Pre-order Meetings as agreed with Commercial Department as Required
•	Always represent TCO professionally in both personal appearance and conduct.
•	Carry out any other reasonable tasks in accordance with operation
Job Requirement:
•	Building and Infrastructure Studies
•	BSc in Construction Management/Architecture/Engineering
•	Excellence in English and Mathematics or equivalent
•	5-10 years’ experience in a Technical role
•	Previously a Senior Technical Co-Ordinator/Technical Coordinator with experience of running numerous projects at one time
•	Ideally experience of working on building, infrastructure, and water treatment plants.
Company Profile:
TCO Constructions & Import Export Co., Ltd (TCO) is a one of the largest and well recognized construction company in Cambodia. Established in 2004, with clients ranging from well-known international organization such as The World Bank, ADB, other International Agencies to local companies as well as different Cambodia Government Ministries, TCO has provided Hight quality construction services specializing in road, railway, bridge, building, ports, irrigation, water treatment plant and drainage systems.

We are passionate about what we do and our partners’ success. We pride ourselves on being a quality and reputable solution provider in Cambodia for infrastructure development construction projects.  With our expansion plan, we are seeking an experienced and Competent individual to joint our company.
